qas.question: During what era was the central Sudan rich in environment?
What kind of rock art was found in the Sudan?
What are examples of the first known archaeoastronomy   found in Nabta Playa?
When was the onset of desertification?
What was the barren desert Nubia once called?
What astronomy devices were built in the Wadi el-Qa'ab?

plausible_answers.text: a settled lifestyle with domesticated plants and animals

qas.question: What kind of lifestyle did the people of the Old Kingdom of Egypt have?

context: During the <a0_0>Neolithic Era<a0_0/>, before the onset of desertification, <b3_0>around 9500 BCE<b3_0/> the central Sudan had been a rich environment supporting a large population ranging across what is now barren desert, like the <b4_0>Wadi el-Qa'ab<b4_0/>. By the <b5_0>5th millennium BCE<b5_0/>, the people who inhabited what is now called Nubia, were full participants in the "agricultural revolution", living <b7_0>a settled lifestyle with domesticated plants and animals<b7_0/>. Saharan rock art of <a1_0>cattle and herdsmen<a1_0/> suggests the presence of a cattle cult like those found in Sudan and other pastoral societies in Africa today. <a2_0><b6_0>Megaliths<b6_0/><a2_0/> found at Nabta Playa are overt examples of probably the world's first known archaeoastronomy devices, predating Stonehenge by some 2,000 years. This complexity, as observed at Nabta Playa, and as expressed by different levels of authority within the society there, likely formed the basis for the structure of both the Neolithic society at Nabta and the Old Kingdom of Egypt.
